newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egyptian overnight, one-week rates fall.
newsitem.headline: Egyptian overnight, one-week rates fall.

text.p: Overnight and one-week interbank rates on the Egyptian pound fell on Thursday in an extremely liquid private-sector market, bankers said.
Most bankers said overnight rates fell to between eight and 8-3/4 percent from 8-3/4 and 9-7/8 percent on Wednesday.
But one banker quoted a range of 9-1/2 and 9-7/8 percent.
One-week rates were between 8-3/4 and nine percent against Wednesday's 9-3/4 to 9-7/8 percent.
The market is usually most liquid on Wednesdays and Thursdays, the last two days of the Egyptian working week.
Bankers also attributed the high liquidity in the market to refused T-Bills bids this week. The central bank received bids for bills worth 1,676.650 million pounds but accepted only 751.450 million.
Public sector banks kept rates steady at 10-1/2 percent.
